private_information: I am agent_1 and I may only move disks: A, B, C, D, E (A is smallest, E is larger).
I can pick up and place only one disk at a time and must respect Tower of Hanoi rules (never place a larger disk on a smaller one).
agent_1.goal: Collaborate to reach the specified goal configuration by moving only disks A, B, C, D, E.

private_information: I am agent_2 and I may only move disks: F, G, H, I, J (F is smallest among my set, J is largest).
I can pick up and place only one disk at a time and must respect Tower of Hanoi rules (never place a larger disk on a smaller one).
agent_2.goal: Collaborate to reach the specified goal configuration by moving only disks F, G, H, I, J.

private_information: I coordinate agents agent_1 and agent_2, integrate their move sequences, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move proposals and produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem (FastDownwards-compatible) that models the 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with the given initial and goal states and the agent-specific move capabilities.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi problem with 10 disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Tower of Hanoi rules: only the top disk of any peg may be moved, only one disk may be moved at a time, and a larger disk may never be placed on a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) B, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top→bottom) D; right peg has (top→bottom) A, C.
Agent restrictions: agent_1 may only perform moves involving disks A, B, C, D, E. agent_2 may only perform moves involving disks F, G, H, I, J.
Primitive move format required from agents: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' (one move per line). Peg names are 'left', 'middle', 'right'.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Using only the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. You must only move disks A, B, C, D, E and must follow the Tower of Hanoi rules. Output exactly one primitive move per line in the format: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL. If some parts of the global plan require disks you cannot move, produce only the sequence of moves that concern the disks you are allowed to move and that are consistent with the public information.

You are agent_2. Using only the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. You must only move disks F, G, H, I, J and must follow the Tower of Hanoi rules. Output exactly one primitive move per line in the format: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL. If some parts of the global plan require disks you cannot move, produce only the sequence of moves that concern the disks you are allowed to move and that are consistent with the public information.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the move sequences produced by agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that models the 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks and the agent-specific move capabilities. Keep the actions belonging to agent_1 and agent_2 distinct in the domain (e.g., separate action names or predicates indicating which agent performs a move). The PDDL should correctly encode initial and goal states given in the public information and the constraints that agent_1 may only move disks A-E and agent_2 may only move disks F-J. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If the agents' move lists are partial, reconcile them to produce a complete, consistent PDDL model; do not invent additional agent capabilities.
